summary: Metriod is an excellent series, but Team Ninja ruined the game.
reviewText: Look i want every newcomer who has heard of Metriod to understand that this is a classic series next to Zelda,Mario etc and they had excellent remakes. And Metriod other M was sopposed to be no exception because of how legendary the fanbase is and the fact that everybody waited years since the gamecube release(which was not bad at all really). Let us go further on to the point and explain why you should skip Metriod other M, and instead buy the classic gamecube version(15 dollars) and the SNES for WII Virtual console(15 dollars) besides you can play Metriod from gamecube on the WII.I played the whole entire game, there were 5 of the same enemy types the WHOLE ENTIRE GAME, which means all the enemies were generic in the fact that you travel through each element and it is the same monster painted differently but they use different elements which could give it replayability but in essence falls short due to lack of variation OF enemies.Last but not least is the cutscenes with robotic dialougue and uninspired voice acting which did not make me want to listen after playing for the first hour and a hafl. Also what will make most of the Metriod community mad is the fact you have to wait until you are authorized to use some of your weapons, yes you heard me right, AUTHORIZED because in the beginning Samus joins forces with the galactic police and the head officer has to authorize even though Samus is a lone bounty hunter. But the reason is because somehow there are hidden items and he needs to restrict you over time until he authorizes it.Nice try Team Ninja, no offense, but you RUINED this game, you are not clever, and you owe the gaming world an apology. Excellent graphics and good diolugue do not get you anywhere with this series, this is METRIOD. The fans desearved better than this, and of course this will get alot of sales because of the LOYALTY fans have, but fans will realize that this is Team Ninja's fault for not putting enough effort into different enemies, bad controls etc. All i can tell Team Ninja or anybody in their staff is to go back to making Ninja Gaiden and Dead Or Alive those are the only games you guys are auctully above average on.Also to Nintendo, they should have let Silicon Knights do a remake, or a sequel down the road, they certainly did a great job with Metal Gear Solid Twin Snakes(Technically a remake) for the gamecube. I hope Nintendo learns from this error and let's devoted game makers rewrite the wrongs of Team Ninja.

description: Wii Play collects nine quick and addictive games that are easy to pick up and play and hard to put away. Thanks to the intuitive controls of the Wii Remote, even the most inexperienced gamers will have no trouble mastering the controls.    <p> Wii Play features nine separate mini-games, including the following: <li>Shooting Range, a point-and-fire game of target practice in the Duck Hunt tradition. <li>Billiards, a simplified variation of nine-ball with stunningly realistic physics that uses your Wii Remote as your pool cue. <li>Find Mii, in which you scan the crowds to find the right Mii—and Miis you and your friends created make an appearance. <li>Tanks!, in which you command a toy tank on a miniature battlefield in a gauntlet of 100 missions. <li>Other games include Pose Mii, Table Tennis, Fishing, Charge!, and Laser Hockey. <p> Every game features a multiplayer mode, so you and your friends can compete for the high score or go head to head to see who’s the best.  Wii Play comes with a white Wii Remote so that your friends can join in the action. (Nunchuk not included.)
summary: El Cheapo games deliver good value
reviewText: You are basically getting a Duck Hunt, a Pong, a Billiards, and a Combat game.  The others are less notable.  Anyway, the games are a good freebie to toss in with a controller.  Maybe the controller is overpriced?  Its a very high quality controller though.

Back in the days of Prototype, I was drawn into the theme of becoming a shapeshifting madman who could claw or pound his way through three New York block's full of infected people. When I heard that Prototype 2 was coming, I was surprised. Prototype 1 wasn't a perfect game, but it didn't really need a sequel. Apparently, it still got one anyway. After playing the game for about 6 months, I've started to like 2 better than 1. Shall we say...it has become much more EVOLVED.In a nutshell, you, once again, play as a prototype, only this time you play as a former soldier named James Heller. Story-wise, this was a wise decision for the game developers, seeing as that most players could have already leveled up Alex Mercer to the max in Pr1; can't really top it. So, get a new guy in, who is actually brought into the trade by the original. In gameplay, you rip through lines of soldiers, bring choppers out of the sky by ripping their tails off, and turn a person into a bomb....that's the fun part. The game is good for stress-relief; just take it out on the nearest tank. You can also consume others to fill your health and give you a disguise; wouldn't mind having that..minus actually consuming a real person.For those of you who are Prototype vets, here is what you can expect:Better power management: Remember when you had that long list of abilites for your claws that you could use xp on? Well that's been changed. All the actual "moves" of each shapeshifting weapon is imediately available, with upgrading things as range and damage available through earning xp. Instead of (for Xbox) combos for X button and combos for Y button for one power (which some you may never use), you get a multi-hit combo by mashing the button and a special move by holding it down, a pounce for claws and a shockwave for hammerfist for example. Plus, since each power only needs one button, you can assign a power to the X button and another for the Y button, so slash away and end with an earthquake! Now, this means you do get less moves for each power than in Pr1, but what they have in Pr2 are the best picks and all useful.Better power balance: Claws became easily useless when the blade was acquired, due to the blade's advantage in overall damage. In this game, each power is much more balanced, allowing uses for all powers in different situations.Better ways to take down a helicopter: In Prototype 1, some ways to take out vehicles was to hit it yourself, chuck something at it, or highjack it. Now, with a little adition to the leveling system, you can hit one button after grabbing a vehicle and highjack it, or rip its own weapon off and use it, or just destroy it right there.Mission-wise, don't expect too much different from Pr1. You go out, destroy stuff, consume people, cut a soldier in half, and some infiltration to bases here and there. What I dislike about Pr2 is that they don't offer bases to sneak into in free roam. Those are only available in main and side missions. But, you still have a good amount of fun in free roam as is.Over all, this game is a good sequel to its predecessor. It adds a lot more to the original construct, almost making you feel like a god when you get fully leveled up. It has good replay value thanks to the New Game+ feature. And, even after 6 months, I still find myself messing around in free roam like it never gets old. Sometimes it may, but it is a good long bit of gory entertainment.

description: The Next Evolution in Pokemon comes to Nintendo 3DS.
reviewText: Hated pretty much every Pokemon game after Ruby/Sapphire and this one is by far the best one since. Great graphics, Fixed the poor POV from the previous games, and is enjoyable to play. Would highly recommend.
